intro: Mercurialis tomentosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf mercury. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas. It has a short stem with opposite leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped. The flowers are clustered in umbels and are followed by small, capsule-like fruits.
